rComments: Norman is probably the best instructor I've had as an art major. Compared to the classes of Katy Perry and any of those poorly instructed Art 10 series classes, Norman is a breath of fresh air and revitalizes the artistic experience at UCSC. As long as you keep on photographing stuff, Norman will be more than happy to talk to you.

Locks is an invaluable resource for any and all art students, especially those in the photography field.  Very abstract thinker and speaker, if you want a clear cut critique you may not get one.  Very useful in exploring new ideas and and getting you to think about your work in different ways.  Great artist and great(if not absent minded) professor

He is very experienced in the field, and he is kind and patient with students.  He is not a structured teacher, but a thinker and artist. Students should have mastered basic photo concepts, techniques and equipment before they take him.

He is very experienced in the field, and he is kind and patient with students.  He is not a structured teacher, but a thinker and artist. Students should have mastered basic photo concepts, teachniques and equipment before they take him.
He helps you by talking about your work (so much) to the point that you realize new things or ideas about your work you might not have seen before.

very NICE. but very vague. just doesn't seem invested in the students. will blow you off (but very nicely). and it's very frustrating when others in your class are doing crappy work (if they do work at all) and he just smiles. you can't learn without critique -it's part of Art process.  He just doesn't seem to care very much. maybe good for intro..
